messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sacrilege
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/17/2002 9:18:22 PM Central Standard Time, ... Well, maybe I should qualify a bit.  We dont like movie theatres.  But we love watching
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/17/2002 9:18:22 PM Central Standard Time,
starsuncloud@... writes:


> ACK! Not movie people? I can't imagine life without all the great history,
> fantasy and drama brought to life as it is in movies. I've learned more
> from
> movies than any other single medium.
>
>

Well, maybe I should qualify a bit. We dont' like movie theatres. But we
love watching things. American Experience and Ken Burns are things we stay
up late for. And we have a lot of movies here, mostly kids stuff, though.
I'm not good with gore or violence, either, so that's kind of limiting with
popular movies. Aren't I a whiner???

Elizabeth


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sacrilege
messages.msgSnippet: ... Don t feel bad, Shyrley, I think most of us here went to public school. I learned typing there.  I learned to type so well, that yesterday I typed my name
messages.messageBody:
12/18/02 02:08:

> You can tell I went to public school. I even misspell my own made
> up words :-)

Don't feel bad, Shyrley, I think most of us here went to public school.

I learned typing there. I learned to type so well, that yesterday I typed
my name 4 times in one of my emails before I spelled it right. Now that is
bad! :)

brenda

messages.subject: Sacrilege
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/17/02 7:09:38 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/17/02 7:09:38 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I've never actually seen anything with Alan Rickman, I just know how much
Shyrley loves him. We arent' really movie people... >>

ACK! Not movie people? I can't imagine life without all the great history,
fantasy and drama brought to life as it is in movies. I've learned more from
movies than any other single medium.

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
